Notes.Text:
This update for python-h2 fixes the following issues:

- CVE-2025-57804: Fixed HTTP Request Smuggling due to illegal characters in headers (bsc#1248737)
Notes.Title: Details

Notes.Title: Terms of Use

Relationships.RelatesToProductReference: SUSE Linux Enterprise Module for Server Applications 15 SP6
SUSE Linux Enterprise Module for Server Applications 15 SP7

Vulnerabilities.Description: h2 is a pure-Python implementation of a HTTP/2 protocol stack. Prior to version 4.3.0, an HTTP/2 request splitting vulnerability allows attackers to perform request smuggling attacks by injecting CRLF characters into headers. This occurs when servers downgrade HTTP/2 requests to HTTP/1.1 without properly validating header names/values, enabling attackers to manipulate request boundaries and bypass security controls. This issue has been patched in version 4.3.0.

ProductID: SUSE Linux Enterprise Module for Server Applications 15 SP6:python3-h2-3.2.0-150200.3.5.1
